nodes.bodyText:
create a wrapper class for calling study builder to hold this information. The fact that you have ?securityToken= in the URL is a detail of the call and does not belong in the properties.
Let's keep the properties files to what needs to change between deployments
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -17,56 +17,36 @@ fda.currentPath=catalina.home
 fda.imgDisplaydPath=/fdaResources/
 
 #User registration server root URL
-fda.registration.root.url=http://${REGISTRATION_SERVER_URL}/myStudiesUserMgmtWS
+fda.registration.root.url=${USER_MGMT_SERVICE_URL}
 
 #For  server
-acceptLinkMail=http://${BASE_URL}/studybuilder/createPassword.do?securityToken=
-login.url=http://${BASE_URL}/studybuilder/login.do
-signUp.url=http://${BASE_URL}/studybuilder/signUp.do?securityToken=
+acceptLinkMail=${STUDY_BUILDER_URL}/createPassword.do?securityToken=
+login.url=${STUDY_BUILDER_URL}/login.do
+signUp.url=${STUDY_BUILDER_URL}/signUp.do?securityToken=

nodes.bodyText:
Please find Dhanya's comment in PR #890
We've followed same pattern in all the services for API endpoints, this requires lot of code changes if we need to build the endpoint from application. We'll keep the API endpoints in properties for this release and address this in next release if we really need to make the changes. I personally prefer to keep API endpoints in properties file.

+signUp.url=${STUDY_BUILDER_URL}/signUp.do?securityToken=

nodes.bodyText: same here, only keep the base url in the properties files; the rest of the path can be set within a class that has knowledge of the userRegistration API

We've followed same pattern in all the services for API endpoints, this requires lot of code changes if we need to build the endpoint from application. We'll keep the API endpoints in properties for this release and address this in next release if we really need to make the changes. I personally prefer to keep API endpoints in properties file.

nodes.bodyText:
this seems wrong, why are you passing the application_local.properties in the code?
What happens when we build the application with a different profile? would this overwrite the profile specific props?
please remove start and end styled comments
